page.title: 01BURTON JOYCE-INTRODUCTION
page.content: BURTON JOYCE Burton Joyce is situated five miles North East of Nottingham in the Trent Valley.Most of the housing and the school were constructed post war 1939 -45 on farming land released as building land.There is no riverside development for the land on the river bank is classed as flood meadow,and is owned by the Severn Trent Water Authority who use the meadows for grazing.Within the community there are no industrial units,even though there were stocking frame knitters and bonnet makers in the 18th and 19th Centuries.The majority of working adults commute to Nottingham, but some are employed in the local services.It is possible to shop in Burton Joyce for all commodities except clothing & furniture.Clubs & Societies ensure a varied social life for all ages.
